alert.note: Alert for Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:41PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clinton and northeastern Franklin Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 1241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Debar Mountain, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Debar Mountain, Bryants Mill, Duane Center, Owls Head, Chasm Falls, and Wolf Pond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
